question.description: **Contains the title or text of the question**.
question.example: What type of accommodation did you stay in?

answer.description: A variable that holds the **respondent's answer for the question**.

DataPoint.description: Individual data point containing question response and quality check settings

qualityCheck.description: A variable that **specifies the type of quality check applied to the data point**, determining how it will be assessed and evaluated.

dataPointId.description: **A unique identifier assigned to each data point**, ensuring that every data point is distinctly tracked and referenced within the system.

question.description:
**Contains the title or text of the open-ended question**, which is used directly to evaluate respondent quality.  

 This variable is required only when the quality check type is set to `OES`. For all other quality check types, it will be ignored, even if provided.
question.example: Where did you spend your last vacation?

answer.description:
A variable that holds the **respondent's answer to an open-ended question**, which is the main part we use for evaluation. 

 This variable is required only when the quality check type is set to `OES`. For all other quality check types, it will be ignored, even if provided.
answer.example: We were at Lake Garda in Italy

keywords.description:
**Keywords are used to perform `wrong topic` checks** and help evaluate whether responses are relevant to the topic. 

By default, the `wrong topic` check is disabled. However, if keywords are provided, the system will automatically enable the `wrong topic` check, and respondents will be evaluated to ensure their answers align with the context defined by the provided keywords and title. 

 For more details on how this works, refer to the [Wrong Topic Check](/quality-checks/open-ended-score#wrong-topic) section.

activateDuplicateDetection.description:
A variable that indicates **whether duplicate checks are performed on the respondent's answers**. 

 This checks if an answer is identical to another respondent's answer or if a respondent provided the same answer to multiple questions. 

 By default, duplicate checks are active, but you can deactivate them by setting this variable to `false`. 

 For more details on how this works, refer to the [Duplicate Check](/quality-checks/open-ended-score#duplicate-respondent) section.

allowedLanguages.description:
**Specifies the list of languages allowed for responses**. Answers provided in languages not on this list will be marked as `wrong language`. 

 If no languages are specified, the wrong language check will not be performed. 

 For more details on how this works, refer to the [Wrong Language Check](/quality-checks/open-ended-score#wrong-language) section.

qualityCheck.description: A variable that **specifies the type of quality check applied to the data point**, determining how it will be assessed and evaluated.

dataPointId.description: **A unique identifier assigned to each data point**, ensuring that every data point is distinctly tracked and referenced within the system.

duration.description: This variable contains the information about the **amount of time a respondent spends on each question or a specific section of the survey**. It helps in analyzing response behavior and timing.

qualityCheck.description: A variable that **specifies the type of quality check applied to the data point**, determining how it will be assessed and evaluated.

dataPointId.description: **A unique identifier assigned to each data point**, ensuring that every data point is distinctly tracked and referenced within the system.

gridAnswersPattern.description: A variable that contains all the **answers provided by a specific respondent for a particular grid question**.

qualityCheck.description: A variable that **specifies the type of quality check applied to the data point**, determining how it will be assessed and evaluated.

dataPointId.description: **A unique identifier assigned to each data point**, ensuring that every data point is distinctly tracked and referenced within the system.

interviewData.description: This variable gathers all relevant interviews used to determine whether a respondent is coherent or incoherent.

example.question: What type of accommodation did you stay in?

AddRespondentRequest.description: Request body for adding a new respondent

respondentId.description:
**The unique identifier for a respondent**, making it easy to distinguish them from others in the project.

**ðŸ’¡ Important:** The system uses this ID, along with the project name, to uniquely identify the respondent within a project, making it possible for the same respondent to be part of different projects. 

If the combination of project name and respondent ID already exists, an error will be displayed with **Error Status 409**

surveyName.description:
**The name of the survery**, which helps identify different surveys. 

**ðŸ’¡Important:** If the survey name already exists, the system will add the respondent under the appropriate survey. If the survey name is new, a new survey will be created, and the respondent will be added to the new survey. 

 **â­• Note:** Each survey within the organization should have its own unique identifier.

activateCleaning.description:
**Indicates whether cleaning should be applied to the respondent**. 

 **ðŸ’¡Important:** To clean respondents, ensure that this variable is set to `true`. Without this setting, the system will evaluate respondents, generate scores, and always mark them as included. 

 When cleaning is activated, the response will include a variable, isExcluded, indicating whether the respondent has been excluded based on the applied criteria.

cleaningSettings.description:
**Cleaning settings for respondents** define the rules for deciding if a respondent should be excluded and marked as low quality. 

 **ðŸ’¡Important:** If no cleaning settings are defined and cleaning is activated, the system will apply the default cleaning settings to determine whether a respondent should be excluded and marked as low quality.

synchronousResponse.description:
**Indicates whether the response should be processed synchronously**. 

 Set this to `true` if you need to wait for the response immediately. If you don't need to wait, set it to `false` and use the [Get Respondent Status endpoint](/api-reference/endpoint/getRespondentStatus) later to check the status of the respondent.

DataPointsQualityResponse.description: Quality check results for a single datapoint

qualityCheck.description: **Type of quality check** performed for the data point

dataPointId.description: **A unique identifier of the data point**

score.description: **Quality score for the data point**, ranging from 0 to 100

category.description: **Quality category** for the data point, this will be only available if the quality check type is set to `OES`

reason.description: **Explanation** for the score, this will be only available if the quality check type is set to `CHS`
reason.example: The user shows several inconsistencies and contradictions, such as different ...

QualityCheckResponse.description: Aggregated results for a quality check type

qualityCheck.description: **Type of quality check** performed on a respondent

score.description: A numerical **score ranging from 0 to 100** that represents the outcome of a specific quality check

reason.description: **Reason for the score**, this will be only available if the quality check type is set to `CHS`
reason.example: The user shows several inconsistencies and contradictions, such as different ...

RespondentResults.description: Complete quality assessment for a respondent

isExcluded.description: **Indicates whether a respondent is excluded based on the cleaning settings specified in the request**. If cleaning is not activated, the respondent is always included by default.

reasonsForExclusion.description: **Reasons for exclusion** will only be available if the respondent is excluded based on the cleaning settings specified in the request. If the respondent is not excluded, the array will be empty.

redemScore.description:
**The respondent's overall evaluation score**, ranging from 0 to 100, based on ReDem's quality checks. 

 For more information refer to the [ReDem Score](/quality-checks/redem-score) section.

qualityScoreSummary.description: An object containing detailed results for each quality check applied

dataPointsSummary.description: Detailed results of quality checks performed at the individual data point level.

projectName.description: Optional project name for grouping surveys

oneOf.title: Synchronous Response
oneOf.description:
**Synchronous Response** 

This response mode is triggered when `synchronousResponse` is set to `true`. 

 In this case, the system generates a comprehensive, detailed response and processes it synchronously, meaning the request will wait (`await`) until the complete response is ready before proceeding. This ensures the delivery of in-depth information in real-time.

success.description: A variable that **indicates whether the operation was successful or not**.

message.description: A variable that **human-readable message** providing additional context or confirmation of the requested action.

status.description: A variable that **indicates the current state of the job processing**.

respondentQuality.description:
This variable represents **respondent data that has been evaluated according to the quality checks specified in the request**. 

 **â­• Note:** If the respondent's status is `JOB_FAILED`, this variable will return `null`.

oneOf.title: Asynchronous Response
oneOf.description:
**Asynchronous Response** 

This response mode is triggered when `synchronousResponse` is set to `false`. 

 In this case, the system generates a detailed response and processes it asynchronously, meaning the request will not wait (`await`) for the evaluation to complete. Instead, the evaluation is performed in the background, and the status of the respondent can be retrieved later using the [Get Respondent Status](/api-reference/endpoint/getRespondentStatus) endpoint.

success.description: A variable that **indicates whether the operation was successful or not**.

message.description: A variable that **human-readable message** providing additional context or confirmation of the requested action.

status.description: A variable that **indicates the current state of the job processing**.

get.description: Get the quality check results and status for a specific respondent

parameters.name: surveyName
parameters.description:
**The name of the survey**, which helps identify different surveys. 

 If the survey name is not existing in the system, an error will be displayed with **Error Status 404**

parameters.name: respondentId
parameters.description:
**The unique identifier for a respondent**, making it easy to distinguish them from others in the project. 

 If the combination of project name and respondent ID does not exist, an error will be displayed with **Error Status 405**

oneOf.title: Job Completed
oneOf.description:
This response mode available when job status is `JOB_COMPLETED`. 

 In this case, the system generates a comprehensive, quality assessment of the respondent.

success.description: A variable that **indicates whether the operation was successful or not**.

message.description: A variable that **human-readable message** providing additional context or confirmation of the requested action.

status.description: A variable that **indicates the current state of the job**.

respondentQuality.description:
This variable **represents respondent data that has been evaluated based on the quality checks specified in the respondent/add request**. 

 **â­• Note:** this variable will only available if the job status is `JOB_COMPLETED`.

oneOf.title: Job Processing
oneOf.description:
This response mode available when job status is `JOB_PROCESSING`. 

 In this case, the system will only return the status of the job, without the quality assessment of the respondent.

success.description: A variable that **indicates whether the operation was successful or not**.

message.description: A variable that **human-readable message** providing additional context or confirmation of the requested action.

status.description: A variable that **indicates the current state of the job**.

oneOf.title: Job Failed
oneOf.description:
This response mode available when job status is `JOB_FAILED`. 

 In this case, the system will only return the status of the job, without the quality assessment of the respondent.

success.description: A variable that **indicates whether the operation was successful or not**.

message.description: A variable that **human-readable message** providing additional context or confirmation of the requested action.

status.description: A variable that **indicates the current state of the job**.

get.summary: Stop a survey and optionally run post-checks
get.description: API for stopping a survey. Can be triggered when the survey is completed. Optionally runs post-checks on the survey data.

parameters.name: surveyName
parameters.description:
**The name of the survey**, which helps identify different surveys. 

 If the survey name is not existing in the system, an error will be displayed with **Error Status 404**

parameters.name: runPostChecks
parameters.description:
Whether to **run post-checks after stopping the project**. 

 This option enables you to reassess the quality of all respondents within the project. For example, when calculating the Total Score (TS) or identifying duplicate respondents, the evaluation can use either the entire sample or a subset. 

 **By activating this option, each respondent's quality is re-evaluated based on the full sample**, ensuring a more comprehensive and consistent analysis.

oneOf.title: Without Post-Check
oneOf.description: This response mode is triggered when `runPostChecks` is set to `false`. **In this case, the project is terminated without conducting any post-checks.**

oneOf.title: With Post-Check
oneOf.description: This response mode is triggered when `runPostChecks` is set to `true`. **In this case, the project is terminated after conducting post-checks.**

This variable **represents respondent data that has been evaluated according to the quality checks specified in the respondent/add request**. 

 **â­• Note:** this variable will only available if the job status is `JOB_COMPLETED`.
